snippet: A student-professor team at Case Western Reserve University has invented a hand-held malaria detector that magnetizes the innards of malaria parasites.
abstract: Disease Diagnostic Group, student-professor team at Case Western Reserve University, has invented hand-held malaria detector that works by detecting the large amounts of iron in the innards of parasite; group is seeking investors to test device, which costs $250 to make, in Africa.
lead_paragraph: A student-professor team at Case Western Reserve University has invented a hand-held malaria detector that magnetizes the innards of malaria parasites.

headline.seo: New Rapid Malaria Test Uses Magnets and a Laser
headline.main: Rapid Malaria Test Uses the Power of Magnets
headline.print_headline: Rapid Malaria Test Uses the Power of Magnets
